name: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Overmind
description:
Game plan is to Replicator out as much memory as possible while using e3 Feedback Implants to keep the Overminds alive as long as possible.

Test Run's will be held in hand as long as possible to bring Overminds back from the heap. Any Levy AR Lab Access held in hand will be thrown into the heap the second Same Old Thing gets installed.

Clone Chips will bring out Sharpshooter or Creeper to get through Swordsman either cheaply or repeatedly, depending on what's needed. Could possibly drop Sharpshooter in order to get back to 45 cards depending on how it test-plays.

Inspired by lolpaca's Beautiful Overmind.

name: HB Glacier-1st Place at Epic Loot Tournament 21-Jun-14(10 pl
description:
Standard Glacier and performed beautifully, went undefeated. Outscored opponent 28 to 5. Subliminial Messaging was a huge addition to give me a drip economy that can not be trashed and doesn't rely on me having credits already(i.e. Hedge Fund/Restructure).

I played Big Rig Chaos Theory, PrePaid Katman, Noise Anatomy of Anarch and Resource Econ Reina with Rook and Donut. The only change I am going to try is dropping the Vipers for Enigmas to get rid of some of my 4 strength ICE.

name: Prepaid Katman-1st Place at Epic Loot tournament 21-Jun-14(1
description:
Relatively happy with how this deck performed. The Kati Jones were necessary to maintain a steady economy that does not rely on PPVP.

I played 3 Jinteki RP Glaciers and a Weyland. I lost to one of the RP decks and the others were close. I think I will drop a Lucky Find to fit in a Mimic and drop a SMC for a third Datasucker. The Scavenge didn't see use either so I think I will swap it out for Test Run.

name: The Tennin Institute for Children who Can't Run Good...
description:
Hello Children,

Can you not run good? Do you wanna learn to do other stuff good to? Then you should come to the Tennin Institute for Children Who Can’t Run Good and Wanna Learn to do other stuff Good Too! Our 4-Click course teaches you everything you need to know to be a professional runner and a professional human being…or clone. You will also learn other super cool skills like drawing, making money, how to use cutlery, and drawing.

At the Tennin Institute, we have a vision. Be you an ant or at least three times bigger, we think that everyone should feel smart and important. That’s why students will take part in our exciting medical research projects like infant cloning and Junebug* and go on amazing field trips to fun places like the Hokusai Grid and the exotic Edge of World resort and spa. That’s right kids, you can learn next to a real live waterfall! Hooray!

Of course, the real star is our running class, the easiest and safest this side of New Angeles filled with puzzles and games to help you achieve your personal educational agenda! Our diverse faculty includes Server Management teacher, and former professional running agent**, Tori Hanzo. We provide the bestest resources, awesomest incentives, and even a little free spending cash to make sure that by Click 4, you’ll be running like a pro!

So, if you have always wanted to learn to make your runs really, really, really, really good looking and impress all of your friends, tell your mommies and daddies to send you to the Tennin Institute for Children Who Can’t Run Good and Wanna Learn to do Other Stuff Good Too!

Children are our future, and here at Tennin, we want to make the future perfect!

*Project participation may vary to roles from researcher to test subject depending on performance. **Tori Hanzo’s appearance will be limited to classes where we know she will be able to impact your education.

Legal notice: The Tennin Institute for Children Who Can’t Run Good and Wanna Learn to do Other Stuff Good Too and the Jinteki Corporation are not responsible for long-term injuries received during on-campus activities and remote campus field trips. Running is a dangerous, accident heavy occupation and students and guardians are aware of the risks of undertaking it. The Jinteki Corporation guarantees to return your child (or a likeness thereof) to you after the 4-click course is completed. By attending the Tennin Institute, you accept the terms of use of all on-campus facilities and medical treatments including, but not limited to, direct brain stimulation and electroshock therapy.

Copyright 2014, Jinteki Corporation

name: 2014-06-20 Runner Draft
description:
Actually contained 5x Underworld Contact, but this interface won't let me do that. So the 2x Inside Man aren't actually in the deck, they're just two more Underworld Contacts.

Late in pack 1, I spotted an Underworld Contract, so I knew nobody was taking them. Then, early in pack 2, I saw a Rabbit Hole. I figured I would give it a shot, so I picked it. Very next pack, another Rabbit Hole. That's when I knew my strategy, and started grabbing a bunch of link cards and every Underworld Contact I could find. I also managed to snag 3 Special Orders and a good enough breaker selection that I didn't need to use Crypsis. I won 3/4 games with this deck (and that fourth one was someone who had SEA Source and 2x Scorched Earth in their opening hand).

name: 2014-06-20 Corp Draft
description:
Apparently this site isn't currently coded for allowing Agendas of any faction in The Shadow, so I'll list the actual Agendas here: 2x Corporate War 1x Private Security Force 2x Fetal AI 1x Government Contracts 1x Posted Bounty

I usually don't run corp decks that are quite so... mean. But this one definitely got the job done. The economy was fast and potent, so I was either able to rush to a win with points, or rush to an almost-win, then get them to bite a trap and kill them. I won all 4 games with this deck.

name: Legends rising
description:
Theme deck around the Nordic, Greco-Roman and other ancient myths.

Meet the staff!

Nordic

In the Bastion of Valhalla resides Odin aka Wotan aka Grim with his Ravens (Data Raven) Huginn "Thought" and Muninn "Memory" (see Archived Memories) and his hounds (Data Hound) Geri and Freki, presumably guarding a treasure chest (Strongbox).
Heimdall 2.0 who stands Guard for the beginning of Ragnarok where the Rainbow Bifröst (Bifrost Array) meets heaven.
And nearby possibly dormant Fenris the monstrous wolf that bit off Tyr's Hand.

Greco-Roman

Ares (Project Ares) as the god of war.
Janus (Janus 1.0) as the god of future and past.
Rex (Rex Campaign ) as the ancient king of Rome.
Adonis (Adonis Campaign) as the god of beauty.
Caduceus is the staff of god Hermes with two serpents twined around.
Archer as the centaur that has been placed as a constellation in the skies by Zeus. Dracō the serpent constellation that has been defeated and cast into the skies by Minerva (see below).
Uroboros as the symbol of cyclicality.

Other ancient

Eve (Eve Campaign) presumably as mother of humanity and Mother Goddess as mistress of the beasts: Chimera the monster and some of the above.

name: Viparinama-Dukkha
description:
The dukkha produced by change (vipariṇāma-dukkha) - the anxiety or stress of trying to hold onto things that are constantly changing.

This deck is really fun to play, everything is in a flux, your bank account constantly goes up and down, your set of program is not permanent, and the set of ice in front of you is changed around with escher.

Account Siphon and FCC are your main sources of econ but in my experience the real stars of the deck are Cyber-Cypher and E3 feedback implants.

Of course you'll find many ways to improve this deck (adding a steady source of econ, more MU, better icebreakers), but then it would lose its namesake.

If you give it a shot, remember to have fun!

name: First attempt at nbn
description: I am starting out playing nbn with girlfriend and the rules are we are only allowed to use before creation and control.

name: First attempt at nbn mix and match
description: I am starting out playing nbn with girlfriend and the rules are we are only allowed to use before creation and control.

name: Bad Tooth v2 (An Upstalk Weyland)
description:
This is my take on Weyland using the new Upstalk cards, namely The Root, Bad Times, and Lotus Field. Essentially the deck's modus operandi is to supplement Weyland's strong operation econ with tons of assets, which it actually wants to protect. Getting The Root behind a Lotus Field or RSVP is mean, and sets you up to rez the rest of your assets for immediate profit. Make sure you know your turn timing chart, because (unusually) you want to know when you can take advantage of both the runner's end of turn timing window as well as your own start of turn timing window when using The Root to rez your campaigns, so you can make maximum use of the recurring creds.

Levy University helps you live with your low ICE. Usually you want to grab Lotus Field asap, because it is essentially permanent once it comes out. Not to mention, Criminal decks are just not ready for Lotus Field right now by and large.

This deck is still a work in progress; I still haven't seen Bad Times be as crazy as I expect it to be, but it is always tempting. The idea is supposed to be that Taurus + Bad Times will destroy even heavily chipped out runners, but I have not played the deck enough to confirm that this works. More often than not, runners have been very cautious about sentries, and whether or not this is because everyone is ready for Taurus or what remains to be seen. In any case, I'm going to chalk this one up to a lack of plays.

The Cleaners is the only agenda that hasn't pulled its weight yet, but I don't need the econ from Government Contracts or Priority Requisition, and Executive Retreat is an anti-combo card, so its a no go here.

name: Big rig Gabe
description: The idea here is to build a shaper quality rig up and then mix an HQ lock, AS recursion, and Emergency shutdown to keep the corp poor as hell through the mid game.
